messages.title: Overdevelopment we can't go on like this
messages.content: The defining local issue of the Putney election has been the threat of overdevelopment.

messages.title: Only Labour can defeat the Tories
messages.content: It's a two horse race here. The Lib Dems and Greens can't win in West Putney.

messages.title: Our first five West Putney pledges
messages.content: Pride in Putney, Curbing youth centre crime, Halting the Tory overdevelopment threat, More affordable homes, Live-in caretakers returned to our estates

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour has a positive plan to turn around the shocking state of Putney's youth and leisure provision and cut youth crime.
Oppose inappropriate developments and threats to local areas, including Upper Richmond Road and Dover House area.
Pledge to build more private and affordable homes and revitalize town centres.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Live-in caretakers returned to our estates
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensuring Ashburton and Eastwood estates can be better looked after, by bringing back live-in caretakers.

mentions.tacticalSituation: It's a two horse race here. The Lib Dems and Greens can't win in West Putney

issues.environment: Pride in Putney - Tackling litter and fly-tipping.

housing.content: Pledge to build more private and affordable homes and revitalize town centres.

images.caption: West Putney's local Labour team with images of Maureen Booker, Daniel Lawless, and Patrick Macfarlane.
Heading 'Two elections on 6th May' with instructions on how to vote.
